page.title: 06The Broadway Shopping Centre
page.content: The{Broadway Shopping Centre,}known as "The Precinct" was built in the late 1950's on the old Fair Ground. This pedestrian area is centred around a courtyard, in the middle of which is a statue of a mother and two children. The facilities include{Victoria {Wine,}selling a variety of wines, spirits and tobacco;{Cut Price}sell greetings cards, sweets and magazines at discount prices; and{Geoffs Toys } an obvious favourite with the children. There are also{Pet {Purchasers Paradise,}many clothes shops, two hardware shops, two banks and five shoe shops. You can sit down and enjoy a snack at one of two cafes, namely{Coalville Bar}and{Turners {Bakers Oven.}Flowerbeds and seats are situated down the centre, making it a delightful place to shop.
